newsitem.title: ROMANIA: BUCHAREST BOURSE TURNOVER AT RECORD HIGH.
newsitem.headline: BUCHAREST BOURSE TURNOVER AT RECORD HIGH.

text.p: High-cap Azomures
fertiliser maker dominated the stock exchange on Thursday with
a special trade which sent turnover to a record high of 25.73
billion lei, or five times the previous level.
Two independent indices touched year highs for the fourth
consecutive session.
"The intention of a foreign investor to acquire a
significant stake in Azomures has been apparent for some time
and I think today they managed to do it," a broker said.
Thursday's "special trade" -- a large deal struck outside
the market and reported to the stock exchange later -- involved
9.525 million shares traded at a total 20.29 billion lei.
Bourse general manager Stere Farmache said the special
trade represented less than five percent of Azomures' capital
which would give the investor a significant position.
"If this investor has previously acquired more Azomures
packages and the stake he holds amounts to more than five
percent, he will have to report that to Azomures, the bourse
and the market regulator in two days," he said.
Azomures has a share capital of 209.5 billion lei.
Five percent is considered a dominant position as it gives
the stockholder increased voting rights.
Azomures was under considerable buying pressure after the
deal, announced in the market in mid-session, closing 400 lei
stronger at 2,500.
The other three first-tier stocks -- a chemical plant and
two pharmaceutical companies -- captured renewed investor
attention and their prices also rose.
Brokers said they expected the upward trend on the first
tier to extend through next week.
Trading on the second tier was dull, with most stocks
edging up or staying flat. "The great Azomures excitement threw
small-caps into the shadow," a broker said.
The VAB and the BIG unofficial indices rose by 6.6 and 4.12
percent respectively from the previous session. The BIG
first-tier index jumped 5.58 percent to 2,175.37 points.

-- Luli Popescu, Bucharest Newsroom 40-1 3120264
